185807508.review: Banished is a simple game that defines a genre of survival city builders. So many other games out there described themselves as "Banished but...[insert slightly different game mechanic or setting]". This is it. This is the original. You can mod in more building types and more resource types, but at the end of the day, the game as it was originally designed is both simple and complex in its own unique way that'll take your thriving population and crush it.

If you're into medieval open world kind of games, this one is pretty good. It's got a lot of grind in a fairly immersive and sorta relaxing way.

185745162.review: Soy prácticamente nuevo en este tipo de juegos, y lo compré hace un par de días sobre todo porque mi pc no es de última generación y me atrajo la idea viendo Vídeos en Youtube y porqué no decirlo, también está muy bien de precio. El juego ya tiene sus añitos pero tengo que confesar que no me ha dejado indiferente. La idea de poder continuar con el juego sin que mis aldeanos se mueran, es algo que me ha llevado a jugar 15 horas en solo 2 días y tengo que decir que por fin he logrado sobrevivir y seguir creciendo en Automático a 10 de velocidad en modo fácil. Es muy entretenido y adictivo, Merece la pena comprarlo aunque si hay que ponerle algún pero, yo diría que lo ideal es que le añadieran combates y modo Multiplayer. Sería mucho más divertido, así como la posibilidad de tener muchos más objetos de decoración, casas y objetos que aunque ya hay mods que lo hacen pero no están en todos los idiomas.  Recomendado....

185458771.review:
Ce jeu est magnifique. 
Créer sa colonie, sans guerre, juste la survie de son peuple, comme les premier colons.
Chasser et pêcher, récolter du bois, de la pierre, élevage des bête pour leur viande et cuir.
Prospérer son village au travers les hivers et intempéries, acceuillir de nouveaux colons qui veux rejoindre notre village. S'assurer de la santé et du bonheur de nos villageois afin qu'il créer des enfants . Batîr des écoles, des marchés, des églises.
C'est jeu est un chef d'oeuvre.
J'y joue depuis des années et je ne m'ennuie jamais.
Ainsi qu'un Workshop fan service incroyablement diversifier.
Merci pour ce jeu. ♥

184602032.review:
I found the game to be enjoyable for the most part. I will say that it took a bit of a learning curve on where to place what for the best results for a thriving village. Once I figured out a system, it became fairly easy to balance the growth and the maintaining resources.  

I managed to hit all the game's achievement goals and found the challenges kept the game a bit more interesting for a time. I was however annoyed by the time it came to Tenure though, I was ready to just be done with it being that I hit my goal of 500 happy adults by year 100... and time just couldn't go fast enough for me to get it to two hundred years. 

Cons:
There were some glitches (?) in which had me scratching my head. I am not sure how people were starving with a fully stocked barn near by, or freezing to death when I had plenty of firewood and clothing there for them. Had to take a break from the game and start a village over again once or twice when those moments happened. 

I wish you could place buildings and structures at an angle, and that there would be a snap in place to fit option. There were a number of areas in which I should have been able to place mining structures but couldn't because you are not able to place them diagonally, so it just became wasted space. 

It does get a bit tedious and repetitive at times.

184378066.review: Played for several hours and everyone just kept dying... this was with 2 small farms and a couple of hunters. Then I found the secret on YT... all you need to do is add a gatherer or two - your town will survive on mushrooms and roots it seems. Add another farm, and a pasture full of cows and before long you will have a population over 60, build a few houses, add a few orchards and mines, and pretty soon you will be up to around 150 people... and about 50 of those will be labourers, so you can use them to pretty much clear resources from every bit of land in a few sped up hours (don't forget to build bridges and house here and there)... sigh!!! Pretty much no progression, no new houses, no new industries from this point and you will be constantly building storage for all the stufff you are growing, mining, and farming...

184324295.review:
The game is fun at first but then you start to hit roadblocks and pitfalls that completely derail progression. I was looking for a nice chill city builder which this one can be but where it falls flat is how confusing and poorly explained a lot of mechanics are.

• Stone is the IRL equivalent to mining oil. I have no idea why the devs decided to make that resource so rare but as I was playing every issue amounted to running out of stone. The solution you'd think would be to build a quarry to generate stone passively but no.. Quarry's cannot be deleted and if you place one every single villager will have crippling depression and never repopulate.

• There's such janky placement regarding mines. They have to be placed near mountains which is fine but they don't snap on as they should leading to some frustration regarding the generated maps as some of them have a mountain placed very far away or some are flat out unusable.

• The issues and problem solving start to get repetitive in a bad way. If I run out of stone the only way to replenish it is by buying from a dock trader but they might not always sell stone. The game does allow mods that buff resource gains but still even with iron, wood and stone buffed I still couldn't generate enough stone to stop my villagers from completely giving up on life.

It's fun starting out because of how chill it is but I can't recommend this game when majority of my time playing was spent looking up how things are supposed to work vs being able to figure things out naturally.

183995634.review:
[h1]經典，有一定難度的村鎮建造遊戲。[/h1]

[b]※無中文。需至steam工作坊下載（簡、繁體均有）。
※可以調整難度，主要是影響初期資源。災害、氣候都可以自己調整。[/b]

[h1]遊戲內容[/h1]

領導一群被放逐的人民重新建立自己的村莊。在逐漸發展成大城市的過程中，你要同時顧好食物、溫暖、效率、心情以及健康，每個設定都是息息相關。

例如說，房子要怎麼蓋，設施範圍有沒有包覆，住宅數量夠不夠讓小孩成年可以搬進去，人口出生率是否可以應付老化與死亡；人民職業該如何分配去收集、生產資源，資源量能不能度過冬季；或者人口及資源能不能應對突發災害……等等，都是需要去思考的事情。

且本作只有四季，沒有白天黑夜，時間流逝很快。

[h1]缺點[/h1]
--建築物、資源就那幾種，除非下載工作坊，不然蓋久蓋多了其實有點...缺乏新鮮感？
-龍捲風這災害也太兇了吧！

[h1]總結[/h1]
我自己是玩簡單難度，雖然開局給了不少資源及人口，但也完全不能大意，因為一樣很容易資源就不夠，然後當你資源數量可以喘息後，就輪到要處理人口老化的問題了。

內容不複雜是優點也是缺點。沒有像現今建築遊戲那麼多的設定跟政策，但也絕對可以享受到規劃的樂趣！

至於價格……真的很硬，非常的硬，斟酌入手。

推薦給喜歡中古世紀風格、城市建造時光屋的玩家。

183959156.review:
简易攻略：
前期背板（第1年搞定食物、住所和木柴，然后开护林和铁匠铺，看机会补铁矿、学校、裁缝、采石和其他建筑，稳定下来就开港口）
中期围绕两个港口先布局伐木业，再布局羊毛纺织业（维持产粮人口在1/4~1/3，木柴和工具不能太低），大量囤积木柴、羊毛衣，换成石头、铁矿，把屋子也换成石屋。
后期开市场建卫星城，升人口。
当然，其实还是有亿点不注意就会崩盘的细节在里面。
中期也可以弄酿酒业，先开伐木业好处是不会缺木柴。

183720791.review:
Maybe this game was really good 10 years ago, but there are sooo many things about it that feel like "Early Access" rather than a complete product.

1) If you select "Easy" difficulty, you will begin the game with buildings already on the map, but they are not arranged in a manner that makes sense with the current version of the game. I.e., you will need a Marketplace in the center of your town, but the starting buildings don't include or leave space for one.
2) People can clear resources and even clear a space for a building but they can't actually build the building until a nearby stockpile is designated for them to move the cleared resources to the stockpile and back again to the building location. Why does it work this way? I have no idea, the tutorials made no mention.
3) People get cold when they don't have housing to warm up, and them being cold prevents them from constructing the housing. So they freeze to death while the housing remains incomplete.
4) Getting the people to actually do what you want them to do is a challenge. During the warmer months, you will designate for them to construct a boarding house so they have somewhere to warm up when the weather gets cold, but they wander off doing random things or idling for months until the weather turns cold and they die while the housing hardly made any progress.
5) The people age rapidly so that their ages don't actually correspond with the in-game passage of time unless you download a mod that is literally called "one year is one year." Yes, that's right, you literally have to download a mod in order for one year to equal one year.
6) There is no "Game Over" screen. You WILL game over many times while trying to learn this game, but the game doesn't even have the common decency to tell you when literally all your people are dead. Instead, you have to know which option to display your population count in order to see that it's zero and that you should probably start over or find something else to do with your time.

If this was a decade ago, I could probably say this game has a lot of potential, and I REALLY like the premise. But this game feels like it was never actually completed and got all the kinks worked out.

I hope other devs will see the overblown "success" of Banished and eventually give us something that is worth all the hype.

183719995.review:
It's boring. It's janky. The AI is goofy. It takes a LOT of getting used to. Sometimes you get decently far into building a town without developing something important and it really bites you.

183605161.review: It's a great game with a surprising amount of depth to the mechanics. You do have to remember it is over 10 years old, it will struggle pretty badly once you hit around 1000 population, the AI is a bit flawed, and it's obviously never going to get an update to fix any other issues you may find. But, especially at half price, I would definitely recommend it if you want a casual city-builder with simple to understand but difficult to master game-play.
